intro: Mercurialis annua f. huetii, commonly known as the Huet's annual mercury, is a variant of the common mercury plant. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open spaces. The foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine.
